definition: old and decrepit/proud of one's age and experience (idiom)

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent

sentences.english: Peter, please. " Mr. Davis" makes me sound ancient.
sentences.chinese: 请叫我彼得吧，“戴维斯先生”听起来老气横秋的。

sentences.english: The stresses of business had beaten John to his knees in middle age.
sentences.chinese: 工作上的种种压力使得约翰于中年时就已老气横秋。

definition: flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
to act young/to affect a youthful appearance
still possessing the innocence of childhood (idiom)
great bitterness, deep hatred (idiom); deeply ingrained long-standing resentment
